TIL - Physics

The Yarkovsky Effect and YORP Effect

Yarkovsky Efffect1: Asteroids obsorbs sunlight, heated up by the light and emmits thermal radiation. The thermal radiations can produce a tiny force but accumulated through decades to change the orbit of asteroids of size less than 30 - 40 km.

YORP Effect1: Similarly the reflection of sunlight and thermal radiation can cause a torque on the small objects.

  1. arXiv:1502.01249, The Yarkovsky and YORP Effects ↩ ↩2
